Servo Valves
Neal Hanson | 3/18/2011 | Product Management | © Bosch Rexroth AG 2010. All rights reserved, also regarding any disposal, exploitation, reproduction, editing, distribution, as well as in the event of applications for industrial property rights.
Proportionals
Proportional Force Solenoid Solenoid current is proportional to armature force, unlike on/off solenoid
Coil
This proportional force is linear within a working stroke (approx 1.5 mm)
Force
Given a constant current, solenoid force remains constant within the working stroke
Armature
5
Neal Hanson | 3/18/2011 | Product Management | © Bosch Rexroth AG 2010. All rights reserved, also regarding any disposal, exploitation, reproduction, editing, distribution, as well as in the event of applications for industrial property rights.
Proportionals
Proportional Solenoid on a Pressure Relief Solenoid force opposed by pressure P x A (area seat 3) Input to amplifier changes solenoid current (output Force) 20% input => 20% pressure 80% input => 80% pressure
6
Neal Hanson | 3/18/2011 | Product Management | © Bosch Rexroth AG 2010. All rights reserved, also regarding any disposal, exploitation, reproduction, editing, distribution, as well as in the event of applications for industrial property rights.
Proportionals
Proportional Solenoid on a Throttle Valve Solenoid force opposed by spring force = rate x displacement Spool position is constant, when forces are balanced Input (coil current) is directly proportional to output force 40% input => 5% flow (due to spool overlap, deadband) 80% input => 50% flow
Neal Hanson | 3/18/2011 | Product Management | © Bosch Rexroth AG 2010. All rights reserved, also regarding any disposal, exploitation, reproduction, editing, distribution, as well as in the event of applications for industrial property rights.
Proportionals
Proportional Solenoids on a Directional Valve Solenoid force vs. spring force positions spool Select one solenoid to control direction and flow 40% input Sol-a => 15% flow P-to-B
a
80% input Sol-b => 80% flow P-to-A Hysteresis
